etymologies: modern Latin, from Latin Amaryllis (from Greek Amarullis), a name for a country girl in pastoral poetry

definitions: a bulbous plant with white, pink, or red flowers and strap-shaped leaves, of the type genus of the amaryllis family, Amaryllidaceae.

notes.text: A South African plant (Amaryllis belladonna, also called belladonna lily), and (popularly) a tropical South American plant that is frequently grown as a houseplant (hybrids of the genus Hippeastrum, formerly Amaryllis)

shortDefinitions: bulbous plant with showy trumpet-shaped flowers
